metadata.title: CVE-2018-18511 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-origin images can be read from a canvas element in violation of thesame-origin policy using the transferFromImageBitmap method. *Note: Thisonly affects Firefox 65. Previous versions are unaffected.*. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 65.0.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18511` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
